intro: Daphne oleoides var. hispanica, commonly known as Spanish daphne, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Europe. It features lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and often have a waxy texture. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and red during late winter to early spring. Its ornamental value comes from its showy blooms and distinctive foliage. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
